title: The Default Path
subtitle: How Flutter decides where to go next out-of-the-box.

leftBullets.title: The Default Policy
leftBullets.description: By default, Flutter uses the `ReadingOrderTraversalPolicy`. This policy sorts all of the focusable widgets based on their paint order.

leftBullets.title: How It Works
leftBullets.description: It navigates from top-to-bottom, and for widgets on the same line, it goes from left-to-right (or right-to-left depending on the text direction).

leftBullets.title: Simple and Predictable
leftBullets.description: For simple, column-based layouts, this works perfectly fine and requires no configuration.

leftBullets.title: Where It Fails
leftBullets.description: This policy struggles with more complex layouts like grids or UIs with overlapping elements, where the 'reading order' isn't the desired navigation path.
